title: Love Is a System, Not a Feeling
subtitle: The audit mindset for relational stability
bullets: We can design rituals that make love repeatable.
voice: Welcome. Today we audit love as a system, not a mood. A feeling fades, but a system repeats. When we design rituals, check-ins, and shared standards, we make care reliable. Systems do not remove romance; they protect it.

title: Inputs → Processes → Outcomes
subtitle: What keeps the relationship healthy?
voice: Every system has inputs, processes, and outcomes. When attention and honesty are the inputs, repair loops and weekly reviews become the processes. The outcome is not perfection, but trust and calm.

title: The High-Functioning Void
subtitle: Everything works, yet nothing is felt
bullets: Schedules are perfect, connection is thin.
Conflicts are solved, intimacy is absent.
The system is optimized but empty.
voice: A warning sign is the high-functioning void. Schedules are perfect. Problems are solved fast. Yet the room feels empty. The system is efficient but lacks warmth. Audit not just outcomes, but aliveness.

title: Audit the Invisible
subtitle: Measure the felt sense
bullets: Do we touch without a task?
voice: Auditing love means measuring the invisible. Ask: do we laugh every week? Do we touch without a task? Do we feel known? These metrics reveal whether the system is alive, not just stable.

title: Design Repair Loops
subtitle: Conflict is data
bullets: Name the pattern, not the person.
Close the loop with a new agreement.
voice: Conflict is not failure; it is data. Name the pattern rather than the person. Build a 24-hour repair window so small ruptures do not become chronic. Close each loop with a new agreement.

title: Rituals Create Reliability
subtitle: Small, repeatable acts
voice: Reliability comes from rituals. A weekly connection review, a daily ten-minute check-in, and a monthly reset conversation keep the system healthy without drama.

title: Tune the System
subtitle: Iterate with compassion
voice: Finally, tune the system with compassion. Protect joy, not just efficiency. Retire rules that create distance. Keep the system humane so love stays both stable and alive.
